title: From which books should I practice maths for my 10th boards, RD Sharma, Prachi, or the NCERT? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

response.answer_text: You should first focus more on building your concepts properly…. Then ….solve the NCERT rigorously…at least 2 times….and then have some practise of HOTS from rd sharma… as well…. Also ….have a proper look on previous 5-6 years papers….and solve each and every question …from it… Then….you should….start solving the questions… randomly …. from anywhere…may be any book…any paper…any chapter ….this would make your concepts strong…. All the very best….!!!

First of all I would like to recommend NCERT…..( it is the Guru of all books ) Then you should go for a bit higher that is Rs Aggarwal…( Latest Edition 2018 ) After mastering NCERT and Rs Aggarwal you should go for Xam idea or 100% EVERGREEN.. HERE YOU WILL GET ALL THE PREVIOUS YEAR BOARD QUESTIONS ….. Also solve few sample papers from there… NOTE : Solve maths Everyday 2 hours.. [ I didn't like RD. Sharma because it includes few high level questions which is not ask in Boards. ] By Following all these books you can get hundred by hundred  in mathematics.. All clear.!!

Hlo, Soumodip Sarkar look when I was in 10th I only do ncert with as much as time and I also recommend you the same and in last few months like in mid November, December and January till exam day I used to do sample papers from internet or exam idea book and this is enough but must do sample papers only if you have completed ncert with practice. Thank you

Considering full time limit of about a complete session, RD Sharma is the bible. It can fetch you a centum if practised properly. Else if you can compromise and want less effort, go for NCERT. Cheers.

Hey… I would advice you to strictly stick to ncert. Once you are completely through with it you may go for Rd sharma (if u r a maths freak) or examplar ( for good standardised knowledge)…And along with them you must go for sample papers (ulike or oswal) they are must for practice. Hope this helps.. All the best…☺
First of all complete NCERT, then practice questions from RD SHARMA.
I would suggest the NCERT. Just do it because the questions are directly asked form this book. Also RD SHARMA is good. Its on you from whome you want to start.
Solve NCERT atleast 2–3 times for board exams, if you have time then solve R D Sharma too , along with previous years question papers
